Figure 10.10(f) illustrates the projection in the original data space.
Example 10.4 (MNIST Digits: Reconstruction)
In the following, we will apply PCA to the MNIST digits dataset, which
contains 60,000 examples of handwritten digits 0 through 9. Each digit is
an image of size28×28, i.e., it contains784 pixels so that we can interpret
every image in this dataset as a vector x∈R784. Examples of these digits
